Given an integer $n$ ($1 \leq n \leq 100$), calculate the number of cells in an $n$-th order rhombus.

A 1st order rhombus is a 1x1 square.

An $n$-th order rhombus ($n \geq 2$) is formed by adding all cells that share a side with an $(n-1)$-th order rhombus. 


Output the number of cells in the $n$-th order rhombus.

You are given a number *n*.  Calculate the total number of cells in a geometric shape that is defined as follows:

* A shape of order 1 is a single cell.
* A shape of order *n* is created by adding cells to a shape of order *n-1* so that each new cell shares a side with an existing cell.
